intro: Dyerophytum africanum, commonly known as the African dyer's plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Dyerophytum africanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
